oai_dc:dc.dc:title: COST-BENEFIT ANALYSIS OF SHORE PROTECTION INVESTMENTS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ruiz, Luis Felipe Vila
de Quiros, Fernando Bernaldo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: shore protection
cost-benefit analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The paper describes the methodology established in Spain to assess shore protection investments. The method consists of two phases: a pre-assessment based on physical and economic indicators and an assessment in which the financial, economic and social appraisals are estimated using cost-benefit analysis techniques. The paper also contains the preparatory works to create a data-base necessary to establish a demand-modelling.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
